intro: Riedelia wollastonii, commonly known as the Wollaston's riedelia, is a rare and endangered flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and other succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to survive.
